page.title: 03HOUSING IN FORD
page.content: Looking at an old map of{FORD}from around 1926 and comparing it with the revised map from around 1957,it seems that most of the houses around now are recently built and not old.The price of the council houses around there,depending on size,range from small ones priced at about Â£22,000,to large very expensive ones at about Â£100,000. At the most northerly end of{BUTT {LANE},which runs through the village, on the westerly side is the{FORD {CLINIC.}On the map of 1957 the{CLINIC was a vicarage and was on the map of 1926.On the{LEASOWES }is a major council housing estate.Opposite this on the other side of{BUTT LANE }are a group of old peoples homes with a Community Room,called{WEST VIEW . There are several farms as well .
